intro: Spongostemma acutiflorum, commonly known as the sharpflower spongostem, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Spongostemma acutiflorum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
